required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Efficacy of Lidocaine Spray Versus Vaginal Dinoprostone in IUD Insertion
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Safety and Efficacy of Lidocaine Spray Versus Vaginal Dinoprostone in Relieving Pain During Levonorgestrel IUD Insertion

brief_summary.textblock: the aim of this study is to compare the safety and Efficacy of Lidocaine Spray Versus Vaginal dinoprostone in relieving pain during levonorgestrel IUD Insertion in nulliparous women

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: pain during IUD insertion assessed by 10 cm visual analog scale where 0 denotes no pain and 10 denotes the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.description: duration of LNG-IUD insertion from speculum in to speculum out

arm_group.description: four puffs (50ml, 10 mg/puff) of lidocaine spray will be applied to the cervical canal and cervix before tenaculum placement plus vaginal placebo will be given 3 hours before IUD insertion
vaginal dinoprostone 3 mg will be given 3 hours before IUD insertion plus four puffs of saline spray will be applied to the cervical canal and cervix before tenaculum placement
vaginal placebo will be given 3 hours before IUD insertion plus four puffs of saline spray will be applied to the cervical canal and cervix before tenaculum placement

intervention.description: four puffs (50 ml, 10 mg/puff) of lidocaine spray before tenaculum placement plus vaginal placebo 3 hours before IUD insertion
vaginal dinoprostone 3 mg will be given 3 hours before IUD insertion plus four puffs of saline spray before tenaculum placement
vaginal placebo will be given 3 hours before IUD insertion plus four puffs of saline spray before tenaculum placement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- nulliparous women requesting levonorgestrel IUD insertion
Exclusion Criteria:
- multiparous women, allergy or contraindication to study drugs or contraindications to LNG-IUD insertion
